title: How to show UNREAD mail on each folder, in TB 140.5.0 on Windows 11?
content:
I've got 2 PC, both on the same version of W11 Home and TB?

On my PC that was install in 2020, I can see on each folder and sub-folder unread mail, total mail, and size of that folder (see uploaded image). On my wife's PC, installed in March of this year, only can show the total mail and folder size?

I've Googled how to do that and of course there is no such steps I can do?

===

To show the unread message count in Thunderbird's folder pane, click the three dots icon ( ...) at the top right of the folder pane header and select "Folder Pane Columns" or "Show total message count". Some versions may also allow you to enable this view by right-clicking on the folder pane header and selecting "Folder Pane Columns," then choosing to show "Total" and "Unread".

===

Right off the bat, no "Folder Pane Columns"???

I suspect somehow this was removed from TB, so new installs this year can't get to it?

I can't even get to that on my PC from 2020 to turn them off?

Is/was there another way? Doesn't seem I have an ADD-ON to do that and I can't locate one that would do it?

Is there an answer to this or is this just the way it is (not)?
creator: irvspa

title: Suddenly unable to send emails
content:
Thunderbird can receive emails but I cannot send them. I get the error message per the screenshot below concerning SMTP.

I have a MacBook Air with Mac OS Sequoia 15.7.2. The error started yesterday (21 November). Just finished conversing with Optus support and they say that it's not at their end: webmail works okay, can receive email and send it (will note there was a brief hiccough earlier today when could not send from webmail, but okay now). All settings as recommended (port for incoming server actually different from what Optus recommends, but when I changed it from 995 to 110, Thunderbird stopped being able to download emails, so changed it back again. Port for outgoing is as recommended, 25.) I tried lowering security, as suggested by Thunderbird help list, and no change so restored it.

I have the latest version of Thunderbird for Mac, 145.0.

My partner, who also uses Thunderbird, cannot receive emails either. He has an older Mac running an older OS.

I have included two images, the second one showing details of selected server. When I clicked 'fetch certificate' it failed. Does that signify anything important?

The error console shows a lot of information, which of course I cannot understand, but can screenshot some of it if that would help.

No firewall, no virus protection, no VPN.

Any ideas as to what might be going on?
creator: thewordygecko

title: drag and drop attachments from thunderbird under MacOS  not working
content: Drag and Drop attachments to the desktop stopped working again with Thunderbird 145. Steps to reproduce: You receive a mail with an attachment. You drag an attached file from this message and drop it onto the desktop of your Mac to download it. The attached file is not saved to the desktop (or any other folder I tried). This is on MacOS 26.1 MacMini M4. Please fix asap.
creator: karhub

title: Thundebird keeping focus for a few seconds after closing window on macOS 26
content:
Since I upgraded to macOS 26 I noticed an annoying issue. When closing Thunderbird window and going back to another application the focus is being kept by Thunderbird for a few second making it impossible to click on the other app.

Steps to reproduce:

  • open Thunderbird
  • close Thunderbird window (using Cmd+Q or clicking the red button on the top left corner)
  • click on any element of the Desktop

Expected:

  • the element is selected

Result:

  • nothing happen

After a few seconds (from 1 to 3), the macOS menu change from Thunderbird to Finder and then everything works properly.

Any help would be much appreciated.
creator: kevin.molcard

title: Thunderbird doesn't open .docx attachments
content:
I am running Thunderbird version 128.11.0esr (64 bits) on Windows 10 Pro. I have defined, in Windows, the default program for .doc and .docx files to be LibreOffice Writer and this works fine when I click on such a file in Windows.

But when I got a docx attachment in a Thunderbird email, and clicked on it, nothing happened. When I right-click on it, it just offers to open (not to select which program to open it with). I have to save the file locally, and click on it in Windows in order to open it.

This is very frustrating, all the more so that it used to work. I tried adding the two following lines to the prefs.js file, to no avail - no change:

user_pref("network.mime-handler.external.application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document", "D:\\Program Files\\LibreOffice\\program\\swriter.exe"); user_pref("network.mime-handler.external.application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document.useSystemDefault", false);

Any suggestions? Thanks!
creator: michaelinparis03

title: Folders added (IMAP) and I can't get rid of them
content:
Hi!

I have recently installed Thunderbird (version 145.0 (64-bit) on my PC (I have Windows 10) and have configured my IMAP account without any real issues.

Except from one thing:

Among my email folders (rather much in the bottom of the folder structure) I see a bunch of "weak" folders (see attached image) – with the name in a greyish tone rather than the normal black. None of them contains any emails (in other words empty), but they seem to be copies of random existing folders as well as previously deleted folders. They all have the same prefix – ”INBOX”

When I right click on them I can delete them, but as soon as I restart Thunderbird (and/or the computer) they reappear.

I have already tried the following: 1. Going to Settings -->Account Settings --> Server settings and ticking the box Clean the Inbox at closing. That didn’t solve the problem either. 2. Right click on them and going to Properties and tried Repair folder. Nothing happens. (I might not have the right terms/vocabulation since I have the Swedish version of Thunderbird.)

My questions regarding this matter:

1. Why do these folders appear in the first place? 2. Is there a way to get rid of them?

Thanks in advance.
creator: silver4
